channel.title: Landing Page on Hackathon Support
channel.description: Recent content in Landing Page on Hackathon Support

item.title: Cloud Architecture
item.description: To get an idea of how a solutions need to be designed to run on cloud have a look to IBM Cloud Architecture. There you’ll find templates for working cloud solutions. You may use diagrams.net (former draw.io) to sketch your ideas. It provides a library with IBM Cloud symbols and icons.

item.title: Get Started with IBM Cloud
item.description: To work efficient with IBM Cloud, install the IBM Cloud CLI on your local machine. Getting Started with Tutorials gives you installation instructions for Windows, Linux and macOS.

item.title: Templates and Code Samples
item.description: Visit IBM Cloud Patterns to find sample projects for various services and topics on IBM Cloud.

item.title: IBM Cloud services and prototypes
item.description: IBM Cloud offers many services and runtimes to build and run your solutions. Everything can be browsed and instantiated in your account from IBM Cloud Catalog. E.g. you may use Watson Services to create a chatbot, speech-to-text or text-to-speech with a GUI without programming. Find more details in IBM Cloud Catalog / AI. We also offer Starter Kits for Node.js, Python Flask, Java, Swift and many more. To get started with DataScience tools (e.

item.title: Get Help
item.description: If you have questions regarding IBM Cloud, don’t hesitate to ask us on our Slack channel #ibm-support. You may also use Stack Overflow to find answers or ask questions. If you ask IBM Cloud related questions, tag it with ibm-cloud.

item.title: Create a free IBM Cloud Account
item.description: Create a free IBM Cloud Account to get access to runtimes and IBM Watson services: Follow https://ibm.biz/cloud-vs-virus to create an account. Ask us in our channel #support-ibm to get a unique voucher code When you received a code from us, go to the IBM Cloud Dashboard: Goto Manage > Account > Account Settings Click Apply Code Enter the voucher code and click Apply Optional: Enter your credit card data.
